verses.verse: The oracle <S%H9294><s%> which <S%H834><s%> Habakkuk <S%H2265><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> saw. <S%H2372><s%>

How <S%H575><s%> long, <S%H5704><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> will I call <S%H7768><s%> for help, <S%H7768><s%> And Thou wilt not hear <S%H8085><s%>? I cry <S%H2199><s%> out to Thee, "Violence! <S%H2555><s%>" Yet Thou dost not save. <S%H3467><s%>

Why <S%H4100><s%> dost Thou make <S%H7200><s%> me see <S%H7200><s%> iniquity, <S%H205><s%> And cause [me] to look <S%H5027><s%> on wickedness <S%H5999><s%>? Yes, destruction <S%H7701><s%> and violence <S%H2555><s%> are before <S%H5048><s%> me; Strife <S%H7379><s%> exists <S%H1961><s%> and contention <S%H4066><s%> arises. <S%H5375><s%>

Therefore, <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> the law <S%H8451><s%> is ignored <S%H6313><s%> And justice <S%H4941><s%> is never <S%H3808><s%> <S%H5331><s%> upheld. <S%H3318><s%> For the wicked <S%H7563><s%> surround <S%H3803><s%> the righteous; <S%H6662><s%> Therefore, <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> justice <S%H4941><s%> comes <S%H3318><s%> out perverted. <S%H6127><s%>

"Look <S%H7200><s%> among the nations! <S%H1471><s%> Observe! <S%H5027><s%> Be astonished! <S%H8539><s%> Wonder! <S%H8539><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> [I] am doing <S%H6466><s%> something <S%H6467><s%> in your days <S%H3117><s%> â€“ You would not believe <S%H539><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> you were told. <S%H5608><s%>

"For behold, <S%H2009><s%> I am raising <S%H6965><s%> up the Chaldeans, <S%H3778><s%> That fierce <S%H4751><s%> and impetuous <S%H4116><s%> people <S%H1471><s%> Who march <S%H1980><s%> throughout <S%H4800><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> To seize <S%H3423><s%> dwelling <S%H4908><s%> places <S%H4908><s%> which are not theirs.
"They are dreaded <S%H366><s%> and feared. <S%H3372><s%> Their justice <S%H4941><s%> and authority <S%H7613><s%> originate <S%H3318><s%> with themselves.

"Their horses <S%H5483><s%> are swifter <S%H7043><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> leopards <S%H5246><s%> And keener <S%H2300><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> wolves <S%H2061><s%> in the evening. <S%H6153><s%> Their horsemen <S%H6571><s%> come <S%H935><s%> galloping, <S%H6335><s%> Their horsemen <S%H6571><s%> come <S%H935><s%> from afar; <S%H7350><s%> They fly <S%H5774><s%> like an eagle <S%H5404><s%> swooping <S%H2363><s%> [down] to devour. <S%H398><s%>

"All <S%H3605><s%> of them come <S%H935><s%> for violence. <S%H2555><s%> Their horde <S%H4041><s%> of faces <S%H6440><s%> [moves] forward. <S%H6921><s%> They collect <S%H622><s%> captives <S%H7628><s%> like sand. <S%H2344><s%>

"They mock <S%H7046><s%> at kings, <S%H4428><s%> And rulers <S%H7336><s%> are a laughing <S%H4890><s%> matter to them. They laugh <S%H7832><s%> at every <S%H3605><s%> fortress, <S%H4013><s%> And heap <S%H6651><s%> up rubble <S%H6083><s%> to capture <S%H3920><s%> it.

"Then <S%H227><s%> they will sweep <S%H2498><s%> through <S%H2498><s%> [like] the wind <S%H7307><s%> and pass <S%H5674><s%> on. But they will be held <S%H816><s%> guilty, <S%H816><s%> They whose <S%H2098><s%> strength <S%H3581><s%> is their god. <S%H433><s%>"

Art Thou not from everlasting, <S%H6924><s%> O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> my God, <S%H430><s%> my Holy <S%H6918><s%> One <S%H6918><s%>? We will not die. <S%H4191><s%> Thou, O Lord, <S%H3068><s%> hast appointed <S%H7760><s%> them to judge; <S%H4941><s%> And Thou, O Rock, <S%H6697><s%> hast established <S%H3245><s%> them to correct. <S%H3198><s%>

[Thine] eyes <S%H5869><s%> are too <S%H4480><s%> pure <S%H2889><s%> to approve <S%H7200><s%> evil, <S%H9563><s%> And Thou canst <S%H3201><s%> not look <S%H5027><s%> on wickedness <S%H5999><s%> [with favor.] Why <S%H4100><s%> dost Thou look <S%H5027><s%> with favor On those who deal <S%H898><s%> treacherously <S%H898><s%>? Why art Thou silent <S%H2790><s%> when the wicked <S%H7563><s%> swallow <S%H1104><s%> up Those more <S%H4480><s%> righteous <S%H6662><s%> than <S%H4480><s%> they?

[Why] hast Thou made <S%H6213><s%> men <S%H120><s%> like the fish <S%H1709><s%> of the sea, <S%H3220><s%> Like creeping <S%H7431><s%> things <S%H7431><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> a ruler <S%H4910><s%> over them?

[The Chaldeans] bring <S%H5927><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> of them up with a hook, <S%H2443><s%> Drag <S%H1641><s%> them away <S%H1641><s%> with their net, <S%H2764><s%> And gather <S%H622><s%> them together in their fishing <S%H4365><s%> net. <S%H4365><s%> Therefore, <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> they rejoice <S%H8055><s%> and are glad. <S%H1523><s%>

Therefore, <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> they offer <S%H2076><s%> a sacrifice <S%H2076><s%> to their net. <S%H2764><s%> And burn <S%H6999><s%> incense <S%H6999><s%> to their fishing <S%H4365><s%> net; <S%H4365><s%> Because <S%H3588><s%> through these <S%H1992><s%> things <S%H1992><s%> their catch <S%H2506><s%> is large, <S%H8082><s%> And their food <S%H3978><s%> is plentiful. <S%H1277><s%>

Will they therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> empty <S%H9553><s%> their net <S%H2764><s%> And continually <S%H8548><s%> slay <S%H2026><s%> nations <S%H1471><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> sparing <S%H2550><s%>?
